intro: Galium kahelianum, commonly known as the Kahelian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly Pakistan and Afghanistan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Galium kahelianum is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
